One of those games you definitely NEED to play. No other words needed.
been stuck in "On a rail" for 5 hours help

Surprisingly, this game IS as good as they say.

Good controls, well-balanced difficulty, stylish 90s sci-fi setting, very well-designed levels with some puzzles spread across them.

Only downside was a bug I had which prevented me from finishing the level "Power Up" normally: Despite doing everything correctly (checked with multiple walkthroughs), the last switch didn't trigger. I had to use a shortcut, i.e. use tripmines as an substitute ladder to get over a wall. This also made the next level slightly harder. You'll see what I mean when you get there.

pretty neat game its old so you'll probably have some trouble with controls and saving but other then that it was a neat expernce. The only down is that in the final part of the game it can get quite boring and you may need to save alot so you dont get set back to far. Over all great game

This game despite the low graphics in comparison to newer games is still a great game. The way it tells the story is a very interesting but good way to do it. And the way it scales the enemies and introduces new things is great, it takes things step by step. If this game is ever on sale or is just cheap id recommend buying it if you like games that have a good story, puzzles , and just overall engaging because this game really does those well.

A true masterpiece that leaves me scared and in awe of the microscopic attention to detail. Very impressive for a game so old.

The gameplay is average, however this game has so much more going for it than just that. The story, the lore and the environments are all fantastic. It's the start of a legendary video game series and it's still an impressive game even today.

A good game overall. The attention to detail in npc activity such as them reacting to the smell of dead bodies and bullsquids eating the bodies of headcrabs is impressive to this day. The game can be a bit tedious and confusing at times. You need use your brain while playing half life. Don't rely heavily on one weapon as the weapons are designed to have a certain purpose. Put yourself in the shoes of Gordon Freeman and think like a theoretical physicist. If you dislike the older graphics and want a more modern experience, I would suggest Black Mesa but this game deserves the light of day nonetheless.

[h1] Released in 1998, Half-Life was and still is one of the most revolutionary FPS games. [/h1]

[b] It put VALVe on the right path and look where we are now. Around 8 games from the same franchise. [/b]

The graphics still hold up pretty good and the gameplay is straight up awesome. 
Follow the story of [u] Gordon Freeman[/u], a scientist working at the Black Mesa Research Facility. One day, an experiment goes horribly wrong, aliens coming to visit Black Mesa, so pick up that trusty crowbar and get to work.

The arsenal is lovable and memorable, you'll see when you play the game.

[b] Final verdict: 10/10 [/b]

I recommend picking up the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/bundle/232/Valve_Complete_Pack/] VALVe Complete Pack [/url] on sale, you won't regret it.
